revised_title: Hydrodynamics of Non-Newtonian Fluids: A New Approach
tldr: This article presents a new hydrodynamic theory for non-Newtonian fluids, which are highly viscous and do not follow the classical stress-strain-velocity relations. The theory assumes the fluid is incompressible and visco-inelastic, and it applies to steady-state laminar flow. Two problems involving the torsional motion of a fluid are discussed, and the resulting stress distribution and force systems are derived.
